name: Active Grandma Strength & Balance Program
description: A safe, progressive strength training program designed for maintaining bone density, improving balance, and supporting independence. This program uses machine-based and supported exercises appropriate for someone with knee arthritis and a hip replacement history, while building functional strength for daily activities with grandchildren.

phases.name: Foundation & Functional Strength
phases.focus: Building baseline strength, improving balance confidence, and establishing safe movement patterns
phases.explanation: This foundational phase focuses on machine-based exercises that provide stability and support while building strength in key areas for bone health and daily function. All exercises are performed standing or seated on equipment - no floor work required. The emphasis is on controlled movements, proper breathing, and gradual progression to build confidence and physical capacity safely.
phases.expectations: Expect mild muscle soreness in the first 1-2 weeks as your body adapts. You should feel more stable and confident in your movements by week 2. Energy levels may improve, and you'll likely notice everyday tasks becoming easier. The weight-bearing exercises will help stimulate bone density maintenance. Listen to your body - some joint stiffness is normal, but sharp pain is not.
keyPoints: All exercises are standing or seated - no floor work required
Machine-based movements provide stability and support for arthritic knees
Focus on controlled tempo to protect joints and maximize bone-building benefit
Swimming can be added on rest days for additional cardio and joint relief

workouts.name: Full Body Strength A
workouts.focus: Lower body emphasis with upper body support work

activities: 5 minutes recumbent bike at easy pace to warm joints
Seated leg swings holding chair arms - 10 each leg
Standing hip circles holding stable surface - 5 each direction
Arm circles progressing small to large - 10 each direction
Gentle torso rotations with hands on hips - 10 total
Seated hamstring stretch using towel - 30 seconds each leg
Standing quad stretch holding wall - 30 seconds each leg
Seated spinal twist - 30 seconds each side
Deep breathing: 5 breaths with arms raising overhead

exercises.name: Leg Press Machine
exercises.notes: Start light - focus on full range of motion without knee discomfort
instructions: Position feet hip-width apart on platform, toes slightly turned out
Press through whole foot, not just toes - imagine pushing the floor away
Control the return slowly - take 3 seconds to lower the weight
Stop before knees lock out at the top

exercises.name: Chest Press Machine
exercises.notes: Excellent for upper body bone density - adjust seat height so handles align with mid-chest
instructions: Sit with back flat against pad, feet firmly on floor
Grip handles with wrists straight, not bent back
Press forward while exhaling, keep shoulders down away from ears
Return slowly with control - don't let the weight stack crash

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.notes: Important for posture and back strength - sit tall throughout
instructions: Sit with slight knee bend, chest lifted and proud
Pull handles toward lower ribs, squeezing shoulder blades together
Keep elbows close to body - imagine putting them in your back pockets
Return with control, feeling a stretch in upper back

exercises.name: Leg Curl Machine
exercises.notes: Strengthens hamstrings which support knee stability
instructions: Adjust pad to sit just above heel on lower calf
Curl heels toward buttocks in smooth controlled motion
Squeeze at the top for one second
Lower slowly - control is more important than weight

exercises.name: Leg Extension Machine
exercises.notes: Use light weight - this exercise can stress arthritic knees if too heavy
instructions: Sit with back against pad, grip handles for stability
Extend legs slowly - do not snap or jerk to straight
Stop just before full lockout to protect knee joint
Lower even slower than you lifted - 3-4 seconds down

exercises.name: Seated Overhead Press Machine
alternatives: Seated dumbbell press with light weights
exercises.notes: Great for shoulder strength and overhead reaching ability
instructions: Sit with lower back supported, feet flat on floor
Press handles up and slightly together overhead
Keep core gently engaged - don't arch lower back excessively
Lower with control until upper arms are parallel to floor

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise Machine
alternatives: Seated calf raise with dumbbell on thigh
exercises.notes: Important for ankle stability and walking confidence
instructions: Stand with balls of feet on platform, heels hanging off
Rise up onto toes as high as comfortable
Hold at top for one second, feeling calf muscles contract
Lower heels below platform level for full stretch

workouts.name: Balance & Upper Body Focus
workouts.focus: Upper body strength with dedicated balance training

activities: 5 minutes walking on treadmill at comfortable pace - use handrails as needed
Shoulder rolls forward and backward - 10 each
Standing march in place holding stable surface - 20 steps
Gentle neck tilts side to side - 5 each
Wrist circles - 10 each direction
Chest stretch in doorway - 30 seconds
Upper back stretch hugging yourself - 30 seconds
Standing side bend stretch - 20 seconds each side
Seated deep breathing with eyes closed - 1 minute

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown Machine
exercises.notes: Builds back strength for posture and pulling movements
instructions: Sit with thighs secured under pads, grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
Pull bar down toward upper chest, leading with elbows
Squeeze shoulder blades down and together at bottom
Return slowly with control - feel the stretch at top

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Bicep Curl
exercises.notes: Functional arm strength for lifting grandchildren and groceries
instructions: Sit tall on bench with back supported, dumbbells at sides
Curl weights up rotating palms toward shoulders
Keep upper arms still - only forearms move
Lower slowly and completely before next rep

exercises.name: Tricep Pushdown Cable
exercises.notes: Important for pushing movements and getting up from chairs
instructions: Stand close to cable machine, elbows pinned to sides
Push handle down until arms are straight
Squeeze triceps at bottom for one second
Return with control - don't let weight pull arms up fast

exercises.name: TRX Assisted Balance Reach
exercises.notes: Holding TRX provides safety while challenging balance
instructions: Hold TRX handles with light grip for safety backup
Stand on one leg, other foot slightly off ground
Reach free leg forward, side, and back while staying balanced
Use TRX only as needed - goal is independent balance

exercises.name: Stability Ball Wall Squat Hold
exercises.notes: Ball provides back support while building leg endurance
instructions: Place ball between lower back and wall
Walk feet forward about 12 inches from wall
Lower into squat position with thighs parallel or above
Hold position breathing normally - ball rolls with you

exercises.name: Seated Resistance Band External Rotation
exercises.notes: Protects shoulder health and improves posture
instructions: Sit with elbow bent 90 degrees, pinned to side with towel
Hold band anchored at belly level
Rotate forearm outward keeping elbow still
Return slowly - rotator cuff muscles need time under tension

exercises.name: Standing Hip Abduction with Band
exercises.notes: Critical for hip stability and walking confidence - extra attention to left hip
instructions: Stand holding wall or sturdy surface, band around ankles
Lift right leg out to side keeping hips level and facing forward
Control the return - don't let band snap leg back
Keep standing leg slightly soft, not locked

workouts.name: Full Body Strength B
workouts.focus: Posterior chain and core stability emphasis

activities: 5 minutes recumbent bike gradually increasing pace
Hip hinge practice with hands on thighs - 10 reps
Standing cat-cow spine movements - 10 cycles
Arm swings across body - 20 total
Ankle circles each direction - 10 each foot
Figure-4 stretch seated on bench - 30 seconds each side
Standing calf stretch against wall - 30 seconds each
Chest doorway stretch - 30 seconds
Seated forward fold reaching toward feet - 30 seconds

exercises.name: Cable Pull-Through
exercises.notes: Safe way to train hip hinge pattern without loading spine - great for glutes
instructions: Face away from cable, rope attachment between legs
Hinge at hips pushing buttocks back, slight knee bend
Drive hips forward to stand tall, squeezing glutes
Keep arms relaxed - power comes from hips, not arms

exercises.name: Seated Chest Supported Row Machine
alternatives: Chest supported dumbbell row on incline bench
exercises.notes: Chest pad supports spine while building back strength
instructions: Adjust chest pad height so arms can fully extend
Pull handles toward lower ribs, elbows close to body
Squeeze shoulder blades together at end of pull
Return with slow control feeling back muscles stretch

exercises.name: Smith Machine Assisted Squat
exercises.notes: Smith machine bar provides stability - feet slightly forward is fine
instructions: Position bar across upper back on muscle, not neck bone
Feet shoulder width, slightly in front of bar line
Sit back and down keeping chest up proud
Depth based on comfort - stop before knee pain

exercises.name: Hip Abduction Machine
exercises.notes: Strengthens outer hip muscles crucial after hip replacement
instructions: Sit with back against pad, outer thighs against pads
Press legs outward in controlled motion
Hold open position for one second squeezing outer hips
Return slowly - don't let machine slam closed

exercises.name: Hip Adduction Machine
exercises.notes: Inner thigh strength supports knee stability
instructions: Sit with inner thighs against pads, start in open position
Squeeze legs together in controlled motion
Hold squeezed position for one second
Open slowly with control against the resistance

exercises.name: Standing Cable Core Rotation
exercises.notes: Trains core rotation important for daily activities - no floor work needed
instructions: Stand sideways to cable, handle at chest height, arms extended
Rotate torso away from machine keeping arms straight
Move from core, not arms - imagine belly button leading
Return with control, don't let cable yank you back

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Lateral Raise
exercises.notes: Use very light weights - shoulder muscles fatigue quickly
instructions: Sit tall with dumbbells at sides, slight elbow bend
Raise arms out to sides until parallel with floor
Lead with elbows, not hands - like pouring water from pitchers
Lower slowly - control is more important than weight

workouts.name: Strength & Mobility Integration
workouts.focus: Full body strength with extended flexibility work

activities: 5 minutes walking or recumbent bike easy pace
Standing hip circles holding support - 8 each direction each leg
Shoulder IYTW movements with no weight - 5 each position
Gentle torso circles - 5 each direction
March in place with high knees if comfortable - 20 steps
Seated piriformis stretch - 45 seconds each side
Standing quadricep stretch holding wall - 45 seconds each
Chest stretch in doorway - 45 seconds
Upper trap stretch tilting head - 30 seconds each side
Cat-cow standing with hands on thighs - 10 cycles
Deep breathing seated with eyes closed - 90 seconds

exercises.name: Leg Press Machine
exercises.notes: Slight increase from Day 1 if feeling strong - listen to knees
instructions: Position feet hip-width on platform, toes slightly out
Push through entire foot evenly
Control descent taking 3 full seconds
Stop before complete knee lockout at top

exercises.name: Chest Press Machine
exercises.notes: Focus on mind-muscle connection with chest
instructions: Back flat against pad, feet firmly grounded
Press forward exhaling, imagine hugging a large tree
Keep shoulders pulled down, not shrugged up
Slow return letting chest muscles stretch

exercises.name: TRX Row
exercises.notes: Adjust body angle - more upright is easier, more horizontal is harder
instructions: Grip handles, walk feet forward to create angle
Keep body straight like a plank from head to heels
Pull chest toward handles, elbows back
Lower with control maintaining rigid body position

exercises.name: Seated Leg Curl Machine
exercises.notes: Hamstring strength protects knees during walking
instructions: Adjust machine so pad sits above heel on calf
Curl heels under seat smoothly
Squeeze hamstrings at bottom position
Straighten legs slowly with full control

exercises.name: Resistance Band Face Pull
exercises.notes: Excellent for posture - pulls shoulders back and down
instructions: Anchor band at face height, grip with both hands
Pull toward face separating hands, elbows high and wide
Squeeze shoulder blades together at end position
Return slowly keeping tension in band throughout

exercises.name: Stability Ball Seated Marching
exercises.notes: Challenges core stability and balance in safe seated position
instructions: Sit tall on stability ball near wall for safety
Feet flat on floor, hands on hips or holding wall lightly
Alternate lifting feet 2-3 inches off floor slowly
Keep hips level - ball should not rock side to side

exercises.name: Standing Dumbbell Curl to Press
exercises.notes: Functional combination movement - like lifting grandchild to shoulder
instructions: Stand holding light dumbbells at sides near wall for balance
Curl weights to shoulders
Rotate palms forward and press overhead
Reverse the entire sequence with control

mealTiming: Breakfast within 1-2 hours of waking to support energy
Small snack with protein 1-2 hours before workout
Post-workout snack within 45 minutes including protein
Largest meal at lunch when digestion is strongest
Light dinner 3+ hours before bed for better sleep
nutrition.notes: Protein is critical for maintaining muscle mass and supporting bone health at 67. Aim for 25-30g protein at each meal from sources like eggs, fish, chicken, Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, and legumes. Calcium and Vitamin D are essential - consider fortified foods or supplements if not getting enough from diet. Stay well hydrated - aim for 6-8 glasses of water daily, more on workout days. Collagen supplements may support joint health but discuss with your doctor. Limit processed foods and added sugars which can increase inflammation and worsen arthritis symptoms.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Learn all movements with conservative weight - RPE 4-5. Focus entirely on proper form and breathing. Rest longer between sets if needed.
Week 2: Maintain same weights while improving movement quality. Begin to feel more confident with exercises. Add 1-2 reps if feeling strong.
Week 3: Small weight increases (2.5-5 lbs on machines) where form remains excellent. Should feel challenged but controlled at RPE 5-6.
Week 4: Consolidate gains - aim to complete all prescribed reps with good form. Note which exercises feel strongest for future progression.
